page.title: 01Cam Valley Whaddon Wendy
page.content: Major Features: situated low-lying Cam valley between clay ridge (N) and chalk heathland (S). South end of Wimpole Hall Avenue (N). Barracks parade ground (SW) A. 14 (N/S) Settlement: part small villages Whaddon, Wendy Wimpole Occupations: arable farming mainly cereal (winter wheat 80%, barley 20%) Few sheep, cattle, pigs, poultry. Eleven working farmsteads (probably 10% population) 1 public house, 1 sub-post office, 1 motor engineer. Other workers commute. No resident vicar or minister. Education: children leave villages, Orwell (primary), Bassingbourn (11+), Cambridge (16+) unless privately educated. Village Colleges provide evening classes and some sports facilities.
